class.name: HttpOutputStream
class.javadoc: The HttpOutputStream class assists the HttpSendSocket and HttpReceiveSocket classes by providing an output stream that buffers its entire input until closed, and then it sends the complete transmission prefixed by the end of an HTTP header that specifies the content length.
the output stream to send response to
true if HTTP response has been sent

method.name: close
method.comment: If response would have zero content length, then make it have some arbitrary data so that certain clients will not fail because the "document contains no data".
Do not close the underlying stream here, because that would close the underlying socket and prevent reading a response.

class.javadoc: data to send if the response would otherwise be empty
